title: 114_hr1715
content: The Act may be cited as the "Executive Amnesty Prevention Act" and prohibits the use of funds. The "Executive Amnesty Prevention Act" prohibits the use of funds for implementing certain policy changes related to immigration enforcement. The Executive Amnesty Prevention Act prohibits funds for implementing policy changes in immigration enforcement, including the removal of aliens through various memorandums issued by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement and the Secretary of Homeland Security. The Executive Amnesty Prevention Act prohibits funds for implementing policy changes in immigration enforcement, including memorandums issued by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement and the Secretary of Homeland Security regarding detainers, border security, apprehension, detention, removal of undocumented immigrants, Secure Communities, and prosecutorial discretion for individuals who came to the United States as children. The Secretary of Homeland Security issued several memorandums on various immigration policies on November 20, 2014, including provisions for individuals who came to the U.S. as children, high-skilled workers, families of armed forces members, and advance parole consistency. The memoranda issued on November 20 and 21, 2014, regarding U.S. citizenship, modernizing the immigrant visa system, and integrating immigrants and refugees have no legal effect. The memoranda issued on November 20 and 21, 2014, regarding U.S. citizenship, modernizing the immigrant visa system, and integrating immigrants and refugees have no legal effect. Additionally, no federal funds or fees can be used to grant any federal benefit to any alien based on the policy changes outlined in the memoranda. SEC. 3. ADMISSION AND LAWFUL PRESENCE REQUIRED FOR EMPLOYMENT AUTHORIZATION. Amends Section 274A(h)(3) of the Immigration and Nationality Act to specify that an alien must be lawfully present in the United States to be authorized for employment. An alien without lawful status is considered an unauthorized alien. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Section 286(n) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to restrict the use of funds for implementing certain policies related to Executive Amnesty Prevention Act.
